title: Is my prayer valid in normal clothes, all of my awrah is covered? assim al hakeem JAL
transcript:
Rukaiah from Bangladesh. Sheikh, I 
wear women's clothing that's below my Sorry, yeah, below my,   above my knee level and it's white and 
I'm wearing a long skirt underneath it. So I want to ask If my prayer is 
valid when I wear this clothing Also I don't wear anything underneath 
the skirt but my Awrah is covered. And my mother told that I have 
to wear something inside it. So can I just wear the skirt 
alone and wear nothing under that? When you're wearing the skirt are 
you wearing an abaya on top of that? No Sheikh. No this is not recommended. The scholars say that in order for 
you to pray you have to have a jilbab. which is an outer garment.   So if women in Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, 
the subcontinent wear a shirwal khamis, they would say that our awrah is 
covered, you cannot see any flesh,   but still you need an outer garment So that it would not expose your bone 
structure, your body curves, etc. and would hide these clothes. So to address your question, your 
dress which is above the knee and underneath it is a skirt. This is covering your Awra, you can sit 
in front of Maharams and other women without any problem being above 
the knee or under the knee. That doesn't make any difference 
because you're already wearing a skirt. And this skirt covers your thighs, your 
buttocks, your legs, so you have no problem. When it comes to prayer, it is 
highly recommended and some say   it is mandatory that you wear an 
outer garment over all of that. of that and Allah azzawajal knows best.
